byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Illinois is among several states that are entering new fiscal year without completed budget and with array of questions over impact on both residents and state employees; experts say number of states with unfinished plans reflects myriad difficult financial questions that linger years after recession, coupled with increasingly fraught political climate.
lead_paragraph: Experts said the number of states still grappling with unfinished spending plans was unusual, as was the level of discord over taxes, pensions and education spending.

headline.main: Illinois Not Alone in Struggling to Pass a State Budget
headline.print_headline: New Fiscal Year Begins Without Budget or Agreement for Illinois and Other States

snippet: Experts said the number of states still grappling with unfinished spending plans was unusual, as was the level of discord over taxes, pensions and education spending.
